{"step_by_step_thinking": "A. This statement is true. Aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase is the enzyme that attaches an amino acid to a tRNA. B. This statement is also true. tRNA molecules, although single-stranded, can form double-helical regions due to base pairing within the molecule. C. This statement is true as well. The amino acid is always attached to the 3' end of the tRNA molecule. D. This statement is false. There are 20 amino acids, not 2, and there is at least one tRNA for each of them.", "answer_choice": "D"}
